intro: Ranunculus multicaulis var. cuchumatanensis, commonly known as the Cuchumatán buttercup, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. It has a short stem with multiple caulescent branches, which is a distinguishing feature of the species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant.
